summary: Internet encompasses the vast digital landscape that connects people worldwide. This collection explores the concept of internet fragmentation, reframing it through the lens of Peter Sloterdijk's 'foam' metaphor. It delves into the idea of filter bubbles and their historical context, proposing a new perspective on digital spaces. The content encourages readers to navigate the internet with awareness and empathy, embracing the multiplicity of online experiences rather than viewing fragmentation as a loss of unity. This approach offers a fresh understanding of our interconnected digital world and its evolving nature.
